cards.description: The light of the orbs can cleanse any impurity and eradicate any evil. Human lives, human lands—all seem like trifles before its tremendous power.
cards.evo_description: The incandescent light of the dragon's orbs can raze the land to the ground. If you value your life, pray that you are never exposed to their glow.

cards.evo_description: Its body is shrouded in a golden gleam; its eyes shine with an evil greed. Those who dare intrude upon its sanctuary are sliced open with sharp claws and drowned in their own blood.

cards.evo_description: The dragoon took his revenge, completing the last mission of the royal family. With that, the dragoon vanished along with the dragon to atone for crimes that could never be forgotten.

cards.evo_description: She is there in conquest's shadow—at prosperity's side. She who counsels with her beating wings and illuminates the future with shimmering fires.

cards.evo_description: So big you'll hurt your neck tryin' to look up at it. And it makes these huge waves just by diving. Ain't no way we can get close to it. —Young fisherman

cards.evo_description: You are weak, and so you fear the world. But the time for such feelings is through. Once the dragon's power marks you, the world will fear!

Tyrannosaurus Rex, king of the roaring blaze. Bathing in magma has given it a body which births flame at the merest touch. Any who impede its progress when it sights its prey will be reduced to ash.
—Dinosaur Island Guidebook

cards.evo_description: The moment she mounts her dragon, it's over. The warrior's fingers barely have time to grasp the hilt of their sword before all is lost. Before the supreme ruler of the skies, all resistance crumbles to ash.

cards.description: For those who respect the sea, its coming signals good fortune. The waters become calm and ships find their way to port safe and sound. To these virtuous souls, the refreshing spray of the waves is a cleansing benediction.
cards.evo_description: For those who disrespect the sea, its coming signals the end. The waters become stormy and ships are torn apart, never to be seen again. To these unfortunate souls, the violent rocking of the waves is divine retribution.
